p: Bronchoscopy: Bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL) may be done when sputum sample cannot be obtained to rule out alternative diagnosis such as tuberculosis and other bacterial or fungal pneumonias and to remove bronchial mucous plugs. Strict precautions are to be taken while doing BAL to avoid aerosol infections.
